channel.title: Webclient Problem
channel.description:
My webclient was working fine... but now it's not, I never changed any code, or uploaded a new JAR, nothing at all, what's going on now?
[code]java.security.AccessControlException: access denied (java.util.PropertyPermission user.home read) at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPropertyAccess(Unknown Source) at java.lang.System.getProperty(Unknown Source) at Loader.getWebClientCachePath(Loader.java:57) at Loader.deleteOldCaches(Loader.java:63) at Loader.init(Loader.java:92) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.security.AccessControlException: access denied (java.util.PropertyPermission user.home read) [/code]
I can see that it doesn't have permission to delete the old cache and upload a new one etc (I don't know why, I never changed it)
I never changed ANY settings ANYWHERE, so I have no idea why this is happening now...

item.title: Webclient Problem
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Deus1993, post:5, topic:437817”]I get no errors in the compiler at all

That is from opening Java console once I load the webclient

EDIT: seemed to have fixed itself… Never did anything to fix it either…

Also noticed I accidentally posted this in wrong section :/[/quote]

Tutorial: Haha owned ;D

item.title: Webclient Problem
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

The compiler says the error. The file directory you are trying to extract the cache to is not allowing it, the fix for this could be many reasons, but unfortunately that is all I can tell you.

Read full topic
